FromIRToPopOnIROptions2.description:
Configuration options for the Pop-On IR converter.

Attributes:
    buffered_mode: Enable buffered cue assembly for ROLL_UP input.
    max_lines_per_cue: Maximum rows per Pop-On cue; None uses source depth.
    end_policy: How to terminate cues ('on_next_cue' or 'fixed_duration').
    first_pts_policy: How to derive cue start time from buffered events.
    flush_on_rollup_depth_change: If True, flush buffered rows when roll-up
        depth changes (RU2↔RU3↔RU4). If False, clip excess rows without
        flushing. Default is True to preserve all content.
FromIRToPopOnIROptions2.title: FromIRToPopOnIROptions2

strat.description: The strategy to use for global rate normalization. See documentation for further details

global_rate_budget_pc.description: In clip strategy, this is the percentange (betwen 0 and 1) of the available bits from global normalization that will be actually used. A value of 1.0 means all available bits will be used, while a value of 0.5 would mean 50 percent of the available bits would be used
global_rate_budget_pc.title: Global Rate Budget Pc

KFSP package specification for runtime install.

- Runtime installs use kfsp caching + DB + file locks; overwrite is not used

vmafsub_ponly.description: Do VMAF only on P frames

predefined_SARs.description: predefined Sample Aspect Ratios to force on encode [None|{(16,9):{'1920x1080':'1:1',...}, ... ]The keys in the dict are DAR to target. Inside every target DAR the keys are a resolution string 'wxh' and the value is the sample aspect ratio to force on the bitstream if this resolution is used,specified as a string like 'a:b' where a,b are ints. Examples '1:1','322:321',..

force_DAR.description: Ignore the source DAR (display aspect ratio) and force this DAR in the encode. String as '16:9'. Default: None

gopsize.description: Group of Pictures (GOP) size in frames. Defaults to 96 frames.
gopsize.title: Gopsize

available_operation_modes.description: List of available operation modes for the profile
available_operation_modes.title: Available Operation Modes

extract_res.description: Resolution to convert the source during the extraction step and before encoding
extract_res.title: Extract Res

extract_method.description: Method used for frame extraction, as defined by ExtractEnum.

segment_frames.description: Number of frames per segment cae segment. Defaults to 144 frames.
segment_frames.title: Segment Frames

scndelim_minf.description: Minimum frames between scene-detected segments. Defaults to 48 frames.
scndelim_minf.title: Scndelim Minf

scndelim_maxf.description: Maximum frames between scene-detected segments. Defaults to 2304 frames.
scndelim_maxf.title: Scndelim Maxf

source_extract_options.description: Source extraction options for the job

tiers.description: List of tier configurations. Tier 0 in the list is the top tier and tier 1 is the second tier and so on. A tier will be produced for every entry in this list
tiers.title: Tiers

override_defaults.description: Allow for the configuration specified in 'omni_config' to override the profile internal configuration. Useful to override the profile configuration with a custom configuration externally
override_defaults.title: Override Defaults

tiersel.description: Only encode specified tiers. Specified as a comma separated list of integers. Default is to encode all tiers. For example, '0,1' will encode only tiers 0 (top tier) and 1(second tier). Some omni profiles require to always encode the top tier 0 (omni.fast). This is useful for debugging
tiersel.title: Tiersel

PrivateCAEDLPars.description: private parameters of a profile. opaque to the user
PrivateCAEDLPars.title: PrivateCAEDLPars

ProbeOptions.description: A class to represent the options for probing a video source.

first_pts_allowed_threshold_in_frame_tim.description: If allow_nonzero_first_pts is True, this checks the first_pts value against this threshold. If the first_pts is greater than this value (defined as a percentage of the frame_time) source check will fail. None disables the check
first_pts_allowed_threshold_in_frame_tim.title: First Pts Allowed Threshold In Frame Time

ProbeOptions.title: ProbeOptions

algorithm_url.description: Algorithm URL to use for the profile.
algorithm_url.title: Algorithm Url

strat.description: The strategy to use for min/max rating this tier. See docs for further details on how to use these strategies

iters.description: The maximum number of iterations to use to hit the rate for min/max rating before giving up
iters.title: Iters

tolerance_pc.description: While doing PCHIP rating the tolerance to allow. If possible the final rate will be within = rate +/- tolerance_pc*rate of the target rate. If PCHIP rate search fails to find a rate within the constrains given (crf search window and iterations) CBR style fallback rating will be used. 'passes', 'delayed_passes' and 'recipe' are used to control the CBR style fallback rating
tolerance_pc.title: Tolerance Pc

passes.description: When doing fallback CBR style rating the number of passes to use if the segment is isolated from other rated segments
passes.title: Passes

delayed_passes.description: When doing fallback CBR style rating the number of passes to use if multiple segments are contiguous using the delayed min/max rating technique (see docs for details)
delayed_passes.title: Delayed Passes

recipe.description: When doing fallback CBR style rating the recipe to use (that includes VBV settings). If not set the default recipe set in general_caedl_pars will be used
recipe.title: Recipe

maxrating.description: The precise settings to apply when doing maxrating for this tier

minrating.description: The precise settings to apply when doing minrating for this tier

segment_rating.description: The global rate normalization settings for this tier

RelativeRateMode.description:
RelativeRateMode is an enumeration that represents different modes of relative rate calculation.

Attributes:
    TOP_BOTTOM_RANGE (str): Calculates the relative difference between the top tier and bottom tier, and then uses the percentage specified in 'relative_rate' to calculate the rate for this tier.

Example:
    If the top tier has a rate of 5000 kbps, the bottom tier has a rate of 350 kbps, and `relative_rate` is set to 0.5:

    1. Calculate the difference between the top and bottom tier rates:
       (5000 - 350) = 4650 kbps

    2. Multiply the difference by `relative_rate`:
       4650 * 0.5 = 2325 kbps

    3. Add the result to the bottom tier rate to get this tier's rate:
       2325 + 350 = 2675 kbps
RelativeRateMode.title: RelativeRateMode

threads_per_task.description: Number of threads for each CAE task
threads_per_task.title: Threads Per Task

job_timeout_seconds.description: Job timeout in seconds. Job will fail if not completed within this time.
job_timeout_seconds.title: Job Timeout Seconds

aws_running_options.description: AWS running options for the job

allow_tc_over_fps.description: Allow timecodes to be over the frame rate. This is useful for some SCC files that have timecodes that are not strictly in sync with the frame rate.
allow_tc_over_fps.title: Allow Tc Over Fps

allow_2997_NDF_sccs.description: Allow 29.97 NDF SCCs. If False, raise an exception if a 29.97 NDF SCC is found.
allow_2997_NDF_sccs.title: Allow 2997 Ndf Sccs

allow_empty_sccs.description: Allow empty SCCs. If False, raise an exception if an empty SCC is found.
allow_empty_sccs.title: Allow Empty Sccs

allowed_bytepair_retime_offset.description: Allowed offset for retiming byte pairs. If None, all byte pairs will be retimed. If set, the parser will allow retiming of byte pairs if the offset is less than this value. Otherwise, it will raise an exception if the offset is greater than this value.
allowed_bytepair_retime_offset.title: Allowed Bytepair Retime Offset

allow_DF_sccs_outside_2997.description: Allow drop frame SCCs outside of 29.97 fps sources. If False, raise an exception if a drop frame SCC is found outside of 29.97 fps sources.
allow_DF_sccs_outside_2997.title: Allow Df Sccs Outside 2997

throw_on_parity_error.description: Throw an exception on parity errors. If False, log a warning instead.
throw_on_parity_error.title: Throw On Parity Error

pad_nal.description: If True, pad the NALU to the expected size for the given frame rate. If False, do not pad the NALU.
pad_nal.title: Pad Nal

pad708active.description: If True, pad the 708 active NALU. If False, do not pad the 708 active NALU.
pad708active.title: Pad708Active

max_ccembed_threads.description: Max number of threads to use for CC embedding
max_ccembed_threads.title: Max Ccembed Threads

res.description: The resolution of this tier as a string 'widthxheight'
res.title: Res

minrate_factor.description: The minimum rate for the tier as a multiplier of the maxrate
minrate_factor.title: Minrate Factor

vmaf_min.description: The VMAF target for the tier. Note that this is a target value and real VMAF will be = vmaf_min +/- tol depending on tolerance setting
vmaf_min.title: Vmaf Min

crf_vals.description: The CRF range for the tier, both values inclusive
crf_vals.title: Crf Vals

maxrate.description: The maximum rate for the tier. This is the overall title rate.
maxrate.title: Maxrate

tol.description: The tolerance in metric points allowed for the final metric value. If VMAF value is available in the crf range selected the final VMAF value for the encode will be = vmaf_min +/- tol
tol.title: Tol

rating_pars.description: The min/max/global rating parameters for this tier

segment_maxrate_pc.description: The maximum rate for the segment as a percentage of maxrate. After applying global normalization of rate a segment encode should not exceed segment_maxrate_pc*maxrate
segment_maxrate_pc.title: Segment Maxrate Pc

relative_rate_mode.description: If this field is set this tier will be cbr style encoded with a relative rate strategy specified here. 'top_bottom_range' calculates the the relative difference between the top tier and bottom tier and then uses the percentage specified in 'relative_rate' to calculate the rate for this tier. For example if the top tier has a rate of 5000 and the bottom tier has a rate of 350 and relative_rate is set to 0.5 the rate for this tier will be (5000 - 350) = 4650 * 0.5 = 2325.  Then we add this to the base tier rate 2325 + 350 = 2675kbps

relative_rate.description: The relative trate to use for this tier, for example 0.5 for 50%. For relative_rate_mode='top_bottom_range' This is a percentage of the difference between the top and bottom tier rates. For example if the top tier has a rate of 5000 and the bottom tier has a rate of 350 and relative_rate is set to 0.5 the rate for this tier will be (5000 - 350) = 4650 * 0.5 = 2325.  Then we add this to the base tier rate 2325 + 350 = 2675kbps
relative_rate.title: Relative Rate

UnsharpOptions.description:
Sharpen or blur the input video.

It accepts the following parameters:

luma_msize_x, lx
Set the luma matrix horizontal size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

luma_msize_y, ly
Set the luma matrix vertical size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

luma_amount, la
Set the luma effect strength. It must be a floating point number, reasonable values lay between -1.5 and 1.5.

Negative values will blur the input video, while positive values will sharpen it, a value of zero will disable the effect.

Default value is 1.0.

chroma_msize_x, cx
Set the chroma matrix horizontal size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

chroma_msize_y, cy
Set the chroma matrix vertical size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

chroma_amount, ca
Set the chroma effect strength. It must be a floating point number, reasonable values lay between -1.5 and 1.5.

Negative values will blur the input video, while positive values will sharpen it, a value of zero will disable the effect.

Default value is 0.0.

alpha_msize_x, ax
Set the alpha matrix horizontal size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

alpha_msize_y, ay
Set the alpha matrix vertical size. It must be an odd integer between 3 and 23. The default value is 5.

alpha_amount, aa
Set the alpha effect strength. It must be a floating point number, reasonable values lay between -1.5 and 1.5.

Negative values will blur the input video, while positive values will sharpen it, a value of zero will disable the effect.

Default value is 0.0.

All parameters are optional and default to the equivalent of the string ’5:5:1.0:5:5:0.0’.

# all parameters with their default values and short handles:
luma_msize_x      <int>        ..FV....... set luma matrix horizontal size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
lx                <int>        ..FV....... set luma matrix horizontal size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
luma_msize_y      <int>        ..FV....... set luma matrix vertical size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
ly                <int>        ..FV....... set luma matrix vertical size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
luma_amount       <float>      ..FV....... set luma effect strength (from -2 to 5) (default 1)
la                <float>      ..FV....... set luma effect strength (from -2 to 5) (default 1)
chroma_msize_x    <int>        ..FV....... set chroma matrix horizontal size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
cx                <int>        ..FV....... set chroma matrix horizontal size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
chroma_msize_y    <int>        ..FV....... set chroma matrix vertical size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
cy                <int>        ..FV....... set chroma matrix vertical size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
chroma_amount     <float>      ..FV....... set chroma effect strength (from -2 to 5) (default 0)
ca                <float>      ..FV....... set chroma effect strength (from -2 to 5) (default 0)
alpha_msize_x     <int>        ..FV....... set alpha matrix horizontal size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
ax                <int>        ..FV....... set alpha matrix horizontal size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
alpha_msize_y     <int>        ..FV....... set alpha matrix vertical size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
ay                <int>        ..FV....... set alpha matrix vertical size (from 3 to 23) (default 5)
alpha_amount      <float>      ..FV....... set alpha effect strength (from -2 to 5) (default 0)
aa                <float>      ..FV....... set alpha effect strength (from -2 to 5) (default 0)
UnsharpOptions.title: UnsharpOptions

VTT2Options.description:
Options for WebVTTBuilder2.

- disable_horizontal_positioning: omit position:% to center cues
- prevent_overlaps: clamp a cue's end to the next cue's start
- max_cue_duration_us: cap very long cues when they are never explicitly closed. If None, no cap is applied and the cue will run until the next cue or end of file (pts of last event)
- min_cue_duration_us: minimum cue duration in microseconds. If a cue would be shorter than this, it is extended to this duration
- include_style_section: include CSS class definitions in the header (future-proof)
- trim_cue_line_whitespace: strip leading/trailing spaces around each cue text line
- grid_cols: number of columns in the rendering grid (default 64)
- per_row_cues: when True, emit one cue per occupied row (overlapping at same start time)

disable_horizontal_positioning.description: Omit horizontal position to center cues
disable_horizontal_positioning.title: Disable Horizontal Positioning

prevent_overlaps.description: Clamp a cue's end to the next cue's start
prevent_overlaps.title: Prevent Overlaps

max_cue_duration_us.description: Maximum cue duration in microseconds. If None, no cap is applied and the cue will run until the next cue or end of file (pts of last event)
max_cue_duration_us.title: Max Cue Duration Us

min_cue_duration_us.description: Minimum cue duration in microseconds (default 50ms). If a cue would be shorter than this, it is extended to this duration
min_cue_duration_us.title: Min Cue Duration Us

include_style_section.description: Include CSS class definitions in header and emit color tags. When False, color tags are omitted (italics/underline still work)
include_style_section.title: Include Style Section

trim_cue_line_whitespace.description: Strip leading/trailing spaces around each cue text line
trim_cue_line_whitespace.title: Trim Cue Line Whitespace

safe_area_top_43.description: Safe area top percentage for 4:3 aspect ratio
safe_area_top_43.title: Safe Area Top 43

safe_area_bottom_43.description: Safe area bottom percentage for 4:3 aspect ratio
safe_area_bottom_43.title: Safe Area Bottom 43

grid_cols.description: Number of columns in the rendering grid
grid_cols.title: Grid Cols

preserve_empty_rows_between_bounds.description: Preserve empty rows between occupied rows
preserve_empty_rows_between_bounds.title: Preserve Empty Rows Between Bounds

per_row_cues.description: When True, emit one cue per occupied row (overlapping at same start time)
per_row_cues.title: Per Row Cues

VTT2Options.title: VTT2Options

cleanup_workdir.description: Cleanup workdir after task is done
cleanup_workdir.title: Cleanup Workdir

WebVTTTextOutput.description: Model that represents a WebVTT output

output_file.description: Output path for the sidecar file

type.description: Type of the output. CC, FN, SUB,..
type.title: Type

WebVTTTextOutput.title: WebVTTTextOutput

source_file_path.description: Full file path of the source file including the base directory and the filename
source_file_path.title: Source File Path

intermediate_path.description: The path where to output the final encodes, also known as the 'intermediates'
intermediate_path.title: Intermediate Path

temporary_storage_path.description: This is a shared storage across all stages and tasks where intermediate data is stored (encodes/serialized data...). This is also refered as to the 'encode_root_dir'
temporary_storage_path.title: Temporary Storage Path

chunking.description: The requested chunking option. Actual chunking may be different to this number due to SCTE35 markers, total frame count, and other factors.

chunk_frames.description: Number of frames per chunk. This field is deprecated and will be removed in the future. Use chunking options instead. If this is set takes precedence over chunking options.
chunk_frames.title: Chunk Frames

frames_to_encode.description: Number of frames to encode. If None, encode all frames.
frames_to_encode.title: Frames To Encode

start_encoding_at_seconds.description: Start encoding at (seconds). If None, start from beginning.
start_encoding_at_seconds.title: Start Encoding At Seconds

forced_keyframes.description: Forcing keyframes in the video. Only one option can be used at a time

timed_text.description: Timed text options for the job request

profile_configuration.description: CAEDL profile configuration. This includes operation mode, profile name and the algorithm url

job_id.description: Job ID, automatically generated from job request.
job_id.title: Job Id

local_workdir.description: When running the jobrequest locally this is the local temporary directory to perform temporary operations by the worker code
local_workdir.title: Local Workdir

audio_input_encode.description: Audio encode options for the job request
